title: Mail Merge Using R Markdown Documents and gmailr
text: Construct data frame content want merge email: Write text email R markdown document. can add subject line yaml header. Use {} braces inside email refer data inside data frame. Expressions inside braces encoded glue::glue_data() function (See https://glue.tidyverse.org/). can use mail_merge() embed content data frame email message. default email shown preview window (RStudio viewer pane, use RStudio). send message, use send = "draft" (save gmail drafts folder) send = "immediately" send mail immediately.
code: dat <-  data.frame(   email      = c("friend@example.com", "foe@example.com"),   first_name = c("friend", "foe"),   thing      = c("something good", "something bad"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) msg <- ' --- subject: "**Hello, {first_name}**" ---  Hi, **{first_name}**  I am writing to tell you about **{thing}**.  {if (first_name == "friend") "Regards" else ""}   Me ' library(mailmerge) library(gmailr, quietly = TRUE, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  if (interactive()) {   # Note: you should always authenticate. The 'interactive()` condition only    # prevents execution on the CRAN servers   gm_auth() } dat %>%    mail_merge(msg) #> Sent preview to viewer  if (interactive()) {   dat %>%     mail_merge(msg) %>%     print() }

what: Merges data into an email and send. — mail_merge
title: Merges data into an email and send. — mail_merge
text: Merges columns data frame markdown document using glue::glue_data() function. markdown can contain yaml header subject cc line. Note 'gmail' supported moment, via gmailr::gm_send_message. using mail_merge(), must authenticated gmail service. Use gmailr::gm_auth() authenticate prior starting mail merge.

title: Merges data into an email and send. — mail_merge
code: mail_merge(   data,   message,   to_col = "email",   send = c("preview", "draft", "immediately"),   confirm = FALSE,   sleep_preview = 1,   sleep_send = 0.1 )

title: Merges data into an email and send. — mail_merge
text: data data frame tibble columns glued message. Substitution performed using glue::glue_data()` message list components yaml body.  can use mm_read_message() mm_read_message_googledoc() construct message format. to_col name column data contains email address send message . send character string, one : "preview" : displays message viewer without sending mail "draft : writes message "drafts" folder gmail "immediately" : sends email confirm TRUE sends email without additional confirmation. FALSE asks confirmation sending. sleep_preview send == "preview" number seconds sleep preview. See also preview_mailmerge sleep_send send == "immediately" number seconds sleep email send (prevent gmail API 500 errors).

title: Merges data into an email and send. — mail_merge
text: Returns list every message, consisting : msg: message mime format id: gmailr response id type: preview, draft sent success: TRUE message sent successfully

title: Merges data into an email and send. — mail_merge
code: ## ---- input-data --------------------------------------------------------  dat <-  data.frame(   email      = c("friend@example.com", "foe@example.com"),   first_name = c("friend", "foe"),   thing      = c("something good", "something bad"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  ## ---- markdown-message --------------------------------------------------  msg <- ' --- subject: "**Hello, {first_name}**" ---  Hi, **{first_name}**  I am writing to tell you about **{thing}**.  {if (first_name == "friend") "Regards" else ""}   Me '   ## ---- mail-merge --------------------------------------------------------  dat %>%    mail_merge(msg) #> Sent preview to viewer  if (interactive()) {   dat %>%     mail_merge(msg) %>%     print() }  ## ---- display shiny gadget ----------------------------------------------  if (interactive()) {   dat %>%     mail_merge(msg) %>%     preview_mailmerge() }
